data.title: Defining basic System.IO types is no longer required by UWP
data.body:
Defining basic System.IO types is no longer required by UWP as it is now in System.IO.FileSystem.Primitives.

Leaving them there results in build errors in projects referencing MonoGame and using those types.

data.title: Remove raw asset support from ContentManager
data.body:
Removes the raw asset support from ContentManager and the Normalize methods from various content readers.  Also removes DXT decompression at load time as we now have content build pipeline support for all common texture compression formats.

Raw assets should be loaded through the various methods meant for this, such as Texture2D.FromStream.

data.title: Issues with XACT when using looping/mixing/etc.
data.body:
I had some issues regarding audio which I didn't really knew why they were happening.

Then, I found out that whenever I set looping or pitch vars or anything else into anything other than default setting for any sound in soundbank, whenever that file plays in game, it messes up half of the other sound files.

I don't know who is using it anymore besides me (cause it is kind of old method to play sound effects, etc.) but I think this is a big throwback, as I had to code myself all this features cause they are broken when using them right within XACT project.

EDIT: To specify the issue... Whenever audio is played from XACT project build, which has in some sound any attribute set to some non-default value, gets played alright first time in the game, but it also messes up with some other sound files being played onward for some unknown reason (they are either playing for like 10ms OR not playing at all OR are distorted OR are playing till first sound after that one played plays...), not only itself.

Maybe it is tied to sounds and cues placed in XACT project after the one with changed attributes, as files before the one with changed attributes were always playing without any issues... I'll have a look at it some more myself, but I think this should be worked on a little, minimally regarding some backwards compatibility with ported XNA projects, which could be using these XACT features.

EDIT2: Not caused by some secific device... It is doing this also on my WP8.1... 
Main development platform: Windows DX Project

data.title: How to properly cap FPS in Monogame?
data.body:
I wanted to cap FPS of my game at 30fps conditionally if being built for Windows Phone, as I don't need it to be running at 60fps on it and I heard from too many it is better to have it capped on mobile device because of battery draining.

I used same snippet of code used by XNA for Windows Phone 7:

```
//FrameRate is 30fps by default for WindowsPhone.
TargetElapsedTime = TimeSpan.FromTicks(333333);
```

But... As it is doing its job capping FPS, it is affecting everything else too, causing stuttering and sound issues. Because of this, I suppose I'm doing something wrong.

Anything which would help me would be great, as I was not able to find anything on the internet regarding this "issue" (most people wanted quite the opposite :D )

BTW... Sorry if I sound stupid but this is first time I'm working with Monogame/XNA on some project :)
